intro: Bulbostylis cylindrica, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, cylindrical inflorescence and is typically found in wetland or marshy habitats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense spikes. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil in aquatic environments. Bulbostylis cylindrica is a perennial plant that thrives in temperate climates with consistent moisture.
